intro: Crepis willkommii, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has small, narrow leaves that are usually hairy, and its flowers are usually pale yellow to white in color. Crepis willkommii is an annual or biennial plant, and it produces small, achene fruits that are dispersed by wind.
